I‚Äôm doing everything in my power to protect Nevada‚Äôs parks and natural lands -- but while I‚Äôm fighting in Washington, I want to encourage all of YOU to get outside today and show your appreciation for Nevada‚Äôs landscape and rich cultural heritage.

I also recently cosponsored the Land and Water Conservation Fund Permanent Funding Act, which would provide permanent, dedicated funding for the Land and Water Conservation Fund. This bill ensures support for conservation projects in communities across America.

85 percent of Nevada is made up of public lands, and without permanent funding for the LWCF, Nevada‚Äôs conservation + outdoor recreation needs could be forgotten. I voted to pass the Natural Resources Management Act to permanently fund the LWCF for generations to come.
The #LWCF has provided robust funding to projects across Nevada, helping to protect some of our most special places and promote recreational access for hunting, fishing and other outdoor activities.

Today, I want to wish a big happy 55th birthday to the Land and Water Conservation Fund, a bipartisan commitment to safeguard our public lands, natural resources, and cultural heritage, and to provide recreational opportunities to all Americans. pic.twitter.com/bN8xvUf4BY
